intro: Ormocarpum ochroleucum, commonly known as the white-flowered ironwood, is a perennial shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are pinnately divided and have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. Ormocarpum ochroleucum is adapted to arid environments, with a deep root system that allows it to thrive in sandy or rocky soils.
